message: it would be an interesting contribution imho

So, here's the problem. On Chrome, when the user installs our app, they have to manually reload the page in order for it to come alive. Is there a way to detect when the app is installed via Javascript so I can do a reload at that time?

There are many proposed solutions on the interwebs, such as putting an image file in the extension's resources folder and checking that http://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/group/chromium-extensions/browse_thread/thread/f00adcb1630168ce#msg_a3d666e654b062d8 OR the extension writing something to local storage and checking that http://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/group/chromium-extensions/browse_thread/thread/772144dd49405674#msg_2d816048211d4ce0
.. but i'm REALLY looking for something that doesn't involve mods to the extension
I am assuming that you mean an installation with a click on a crx file.
otherwise if you unpack the crx file you might add some code that calls the kynetx app just after install if there is such event defined in the chrome api
I would call the app's bookmarklet when the user clicks on the install link for this particular situation
or use a settimeout with a callback to a page refresh
no clean solution but it might be good enough
don't think bookmarklet or setTimeout are good user experiences, confusing for the former and unreliable for the latter
